bill_title: to revise certain provisions regarding child protection teams.

bill_versions.bill_text: FOR AN ACT ENTITLED, An Act to revise certain provisions regarding child protection teams. BE IT ENACTED BY THE LEGISLATURE OF THE STATE OF SOUTH DAKOTA: Section 1. That § 26-8A-17 be amended to read as follows: 26-8A-17. The secretary of social services may appoint child protection teams to assist in the prevention and treatment of child abuse and neglect. A child protection team may include licensed or certified medical and health professionals, the court services officer recommended by the presiding judge of a judicial circuit in which the team is to operate, the secretaries of social services and health or their designees, a representative of a mental health center, a representative of a public school district in which the team is to operate, an attorney, a foster parent and one or more representatives of the public. The Department of Social Services shall maintain a record of the membership of each child protection team. The Department of Social Services may promulgate rules, pursuant to chapter 1-26, to define the operation of child protection teams including the scope, membership, organization, criteria for applying for and accepting funds, and record-keeping requirements. 750 copies of this document were printed by the South Dakota Legislative Research Council at a cost of $.015 per page. . Insertions into existing statutes are indicated by underscores. Deletions from existing statutes are indicated by overstrikes.

action_log.status_text: First read in House and referred to
